channel.title: I get this error
channel.description:
Does anyone know what it might be? :confused:
[IMG]http://img244.imageshack.us/img244/1496/erroruq4.png[/img]

item.title: I get this error
item.dc:creator: @adu adu
item.description:
@adu wrote:

1)bind exception.

First try ctrl+ alt+del and end all java.exe, if that still gives you the bind exception then continue reading on

World.xml

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="no"?>



RSCD Config
1
Your IP Here (the one that starts with 192.168..**)
43594
RSCDaemon
Scotland
600
1
Your IP Here (the one that starts with 192.168..**)
34522

Ls.conf

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="no"?>



RSCD-LS Config
KEEP THIS LOCLHOST
rscd
root

Your IP Here (the one that starts with 192.168..*)
34522
Your IP Here (the one that starts with 192.168..***)
8181

As far as your SQL error goes

Goto phpmyadmin

In table ‘users’, you need a user that has an id of 1 and a group id of 3 which represents an anonymous user.

Read full topic

item.title: I get this error
item.dc:creator: @Maskmanator Maskmanator
item.description:
@Maskmanator wrote:

Still the same error I tried setting both to my internal and then lsip to my internal and ip to my external and vise versa, nothing worked. [br][br][size=1]Posted on: January 22, 2009, 01:23:58 pm[/size][hr]<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="no"?>

Open RSCD_v25 Config 1 24.209.40.162 43594 rscd US 300 1 192.168.1.2 34522 password

That is my world.xml[br][br][size=1]Posted on: January 22, 2009, 01:27:34 pm[/size][hr]I also don’t know if this has to do with anything, but I get

“Unable to fetch guest information. The table ‘users’ must contain an entry with id = 1 that represents anonymous users.”

when I try to access my http:/localhost/[br][br][size=1]Posted on: January 22, 2009, 05:04:43 pm[/size][hr]Anyone know?

Read full topic

item.title: I get this error
item.dc:creator: @marwolf marwolf
item.description:
@marwolf wrote:

If you have your external IP address set in world.xml, change that to your internal IP address. In my case I have to use 192.168.1.103 (You can find this by going to Start > Run > type in CMD > type in IPCONFIG into the command prompt. It should have a couple IP address sections listed, one for your external IP, one for your internal IP, and any others if you have other software installed such as VMware Player.

Read full topic

item.title: I get this error
item.dc:creator: @marwolf marwolf
item.description:
@marwolf wrote:

  1. Open Notepad and type in:

tskill java /a

  1. Then save it as Kill_Java.bat

  2. Run Kill_Java.bat and that will completely close any hidden copies of the server that might still be running since the last time you closed it. The cannot assign address bind error means that a copy of the server is already running and using that port address. This should clear that up for you.

Read full topic
